column4: guys is there some software that I can change wallpapers every x minutes from art.gnome.org ?
yes. look at www.gnomefiles.org. they are several
what I'm saying is I want an automated tool kinda thing, is there something like that?
take a look at this site. i have seen several such applications. never tried any of them so i can't recommend any
I have seen that site several times, I have tried gnome-art quite a bit but it doesn't fit my bill as of yet
i'm not speaking about gnome-art but about www.gnomefiles.org. you need a sleep perhaps?
saw it fully, the only program which comes close to what I want (lifting wallpapers) from art.gnome.org is done only by art manager or Gnome-Art
I didn't find any other application which does that
this is not an error. it just shows the fragmentation level of the file system
ok cool, but why it should show as failed for fdisk ? and I have seen it happens I think every boot or every 2nd boot, is that normal?
failing is another story. it's not related to the fragmentation level at all
if fdisk failing is not normal, what should I do about that?
is this your root file system?
sorry been also trouble-shooting some other stuff as well, yes this is my root file system
ok. so it's best to boot the life cd and check the file system from it. the default behaviour -A is not that efficient.
i suspect that you get the error because it simply doesn't gets repaired on boot
